audios.au: ... due to the increased weight the air in the supporting bellows is compressed and the load platform is accordingly lowered.
The ECAS ECU recognizes via the height sensors the deviation from the reference level.
At first the supply pressure for both valves is unlocked via the rear axle valve.
After that the front axle valve as well as the two solenoid valves inside of the rear axle valve are individually controlled, until the reference level has been reached at each sensor.
When the load is reduced, in this case by the weight of the forklift, the level is regulated again by venting the supporting bellows.
